result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon David Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leon David Kirk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leon David Kirk was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Leon David Kirk was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  John A Kucinski   DF:  Leon David Kirk appeared. Case called at 2:23 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a pre trial conference. Atty Kucinski states there is an agreement. Recites resolution.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct's 3 Retail Theft and Ct. 4 Carry Concealed Weapon in 16CF29. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct's 3 Retail Theft and Ct. 4 Carry Concealed Weapon in 16CF29. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 8 & 9 in 16CF29. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:
In Count 3:
- Fine inclusive of costs in the amount of $750.00. Bond to apply. 

- DNA Sample

In Count 4:
- Fine inclusive of costs in the amount of $750.00. Bond to apply.

- DNA Sample
Pre-trial conference on July 26, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

ADA Kelly requesting this matter be reset 30 days out. No current resolution. Court will reset matter. Address confirmed. Bond continues. per RMW 5/23/17 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Pre-trial conference on June 12, 2017 at 10:30 am.

* AMENDED *

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges. Check in only for purposes of address. No testing requirement.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  John A Kucinski   DF:  Leon David Kirk appeared from jail via video conferencing. Case called at 1:11 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a return on warrant. Atty Kucinski gives argument.  State requesting a cash bond due to prior missed court appearances. Atty Kucinski requesting a new court date. DE states was homeless at the time and that is why missed court in February. DE is not currently under supervision. Rule 25 in MN.  Court QUASHES warrant and will reinstate original bond but add DRC. DE will need to sign a pre-signed waiver of extradition.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 10:30 am.
